intro: Spergula rupicola, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and arid regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to survive in poor soil conditions and is often found on limestone or chalky substrates. Spergula rupicola is typically found in open habitats such as rocky outcrops and gravelly slopes.
